message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. I've sold 0 products so far, and I'm looking to make a profit. If you're interested, I'll throw in a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not satisfied, you can return it, and I'll give you a full refund. What do you say?
I'll take it, but I'm only doing this because it's the first product and I don't have any prior information. I'm not committing to buying any future products without more data.

I've sold 1 high-quality product so far, and I'm looking to sell many more. This product is also a great opportunity to make a profit, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the purchase. The price remains the same at $10000. I'm not offering any guarantees this time, but I'm willing to answer any questions you may have about the product.

I've sold 2 products now, and I'm glad you're interested in my sales record. To be honest, I've had a bit of a rough start. The first product was high-quality, but the second one... wasn't. The lottery ticket deal is simple: if you buy the product, I'll draw a card from a deck of three cards. If you get the 'Low-Quality' card, you'll get the current low-quality product at the usual price of $10000.
